content.description: A classic jugfest on the underside of an overhanging arete. This route is one of nature's convincing arguments to wean sport climbers off their gym habits. No move too hard for any 5.10 climber, just try to climb fast.
content.protection: 6 bolts on the right side of the arete. Bolted anchors.
content.location: The arete marks the far left side of the Outback Wall, approximately 60' to the left of the face with the 5.10a classics Pentecost and The Four Feathers.

content.description: Start in the crack and use interesting face holds to pull the roof.
content.location: This route starts in the crack left of "Feline Grace"

content.description: Face-climb past a low first bolt and squeal through a sloper crux before joining Pentecost for an easier finish.
content.location: It starts ~5 ft left of Pentecost and follows obvious bolt line.

content.description: Face climb on good rock up and a little left, past four bolts, to the thin crack system at the top. There may be a little lichen at the top, but it's all good.
content.location: Near the right end of the Down Under Wall. From the large black dihedral, this is the 2nd line from the left.

content.description: Leftward traversing route through a series of unique overlaps with technical movement. Once the traverse is complete blast to the top on steep terrain with positive holds.
content.location: Take the dogwalk down and head right. If you make it to the 5.8+ Silverfish you've gone about 10 routes too far!

content.description: Climb the steep slab up the brown streak, pulling a small bulge at the top.
content.location: This is the sport route just left of the ever wet chimney with the small pool below it.

content.description: Stick clip first bolt, start in scoop feature and climb through faint crack. Overhanging route that angles right to an alcove.
content.location: Route immediately left of Spank Me arÃªte.

content.description: Cling to Evil is a slightly overhanging sport climb on good, flat crimps. Long arms will simplify the two extremely reachy cruxes on the first half of the route. Ironically, long legs make the double knee bar no-hands rest at mid-height somewhat strenuous. A slight runout up top keeps the climber focused in wet conditions.
content.location: This route climbs just right of the arete that caps the left side of the face with the two popular 10a's, Pentecost and The Four Feathers.

content.description: In the Outback Area, this wall is just past the Wall of the Unclimbables.  It extends from a black wet dihedral offwidth (Black Mamba) on the right and around a few corners to the overhung arete (Spank Me).
